summary: Build a romantic, cute, interactive website (HTML/CSS/JS) served via Python Flask featuring an animated gift box intro, click-triggered character/heart animations, and voice playback with responsive design.
architectural_notes: Frontend: HTML/CSS/JS with CSS keyframe animations for gift opening, character movement/kneel, and floating hearts
Audio: Use Web Speech API speechSynthesis for voice playback on load and on click sequence (with fallback handling as needed)
Backend: Python Flask app serving index and static assets (CSS/JS), suitable for local run
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Cute closed gift box illustration, front view, soft pastel style (gift-box-closed.dim_512x512.png)
- Cute open gift box illustration, matching style (gift-box-open.dim_512x512.png)
- Cute cartoon boy character, standing pose, transparent background (cute-boy-stand.dim_512x512.png)
- Cute cartoon boy character, kneeling pose, transparent background (cute-boy-kneel.dim_512x512.png)
- Cute cartoon girl character, standing pose, transparent background (cute-girl-stand.dim_512x512.png)
- Small floating heart icon set style (heart-icon.dim_128x128.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page romantic interactive experience that initially shows a cute animated gift box centered on the screen over a soft romantic pink/purple gradient background.

Implement voice playback using the browser Web Speech API to speak: "Medha, open your gift" on initial load, with a graceful fallback UX for browsers that block autoplay (e.g., show a small on-screen prompt to enable sound via a tap/click).

On gift box click/tap, run a single, smooth animation sequence: gift opens; a cute animated boy and cute animated girl appear; the boy walks forward and kneels; heart animations float in the background; the voice speaks "I love you"; and the on-screen text "I love you ❤️" appears.

Implement the interactive scene using clean, well-commented React + TypeScript code and CSS/Tailwind styling (no adult content), keeping the overall look cute, romantic, and consistent across components.

Do not implement a Python/Flask server; instead, serve the site using the existing Internet Computer frontend setup and keep the backend minimal (no backend changes unless needed for serving or configuration).
Add any required custom art as static assets (not served through the backend) and reference them from the frontend. Prefer cute, simple illustrations that match the romantic theme.
